member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivity
member.summary: An Activity is a subtype of Object (here implemented as ) that describes some form of action that may happen, is currently happening, or has already happened. The Activity type itself serves as an abstract base type for all types of activities. It is important to note that the Activity type itself does not carry any specific semantics about the kind of action being taken. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivity.Object
member.summary: When used within an Activity, describes the direct object of the activity. For instance, in the activity "John added a movie to his wishlist", the object of the activity is the movie added. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivityBase
member.summary:
An Activity is a subtype of Object (here implemented as ) that describes some form of action that may happen, is currently happening, or has already happened. The Activity type itself serves as an abstract base type for all types of activities. It is important to note that the Activity type itself does not carry any specific semantics about the kind of action being taken.
acts as an abstract base class for Activity implementations which cannot contain an object property (i.e. ). See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivityBase.Actor
member.summary: Describes one or more entities that either performed or are expected to perform the activity. Any single activity can have multiple actors. The actor may be specified using an indirect Link (here implemented as ). Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivityBase.Target
member.summary: Describes the indirect object, or target, of the activity. The precise meaning of the target is largely dependent on the type of action being described but will often be the object of the English preposition "to". For instance, in the activity "John added a movie to his wishlist", the target of the activity is John's wishlist. An activity can have more than one target. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivityBase.Result
member.summary: Describes the result of the activity. For instance, if a particular action results in the creation of a new resource, the result property can be used to describe that new resource. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivityBase.Origin
member.summary: Describes an indirect object of the activity from which the activity is directed. The precise meaning of the origin is the object of the English preposition "from". For instance, in the activity "John moved an item to List B from List A", the origin of the activity is "List A". Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IActivityBase.Instrument
member.summary: Identifies one or more objects used (or to be used) in the completion of an Activity (here implemented as ). Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Activity.IIntrasitiveActivity
member.summary: Instances of IntransitiveActivity are a subtype of Activity (here implemented as ) representing intransitive actions. The object property is therefore inappropriate for these activities. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollection
member.summary:
A Collection is a subtype of Object (here implemented as ) that represents ordered or unordered sets of Object or Link (here implemented as ) instances.
Refer to the Activity Streams 2.0 Core specification for a complete description of the Collection type. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollection.TotalItems
member.summary: A non-negative integer specifying the total number of objects contained by the logical view of the collection. This number might not reflect the actual number of items serialized within the Collection object instance. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollection.Current
member.summary: In a paged Collection (here implemented as ), indicates the page that contains the most recently updated member items. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollection.First
member.summary: In a paged Collection (here implemented as ), indicates the furthest preceeding page of items in the collection. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollection.Last
member.summary: In a paged Collection (here implemented as ), indicates the furthest proceeding page of the collection. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollection.Items
member.summary: Identifies the items contained in a collection. The items might be ordered or unordered. Must be either or or of the same. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollectionPage
member.summary: Used to represent distinct subsets of items from a Collection (here implemented as ). Refer to the Activity Streams 2.0 Core specification for a complete description of the CollectionPage object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollectionPage.PartOf
member.summary: Identifies the Collection to which a CollectionPage objects items belong. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollectionPage.Next
member.summary: In a paged Collection (here implemented as ), indicates the next page of items. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.ICollectionPage.Prev
member.summary: In a paged Collection (here implemented as ), identifies the previous page of items.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.IOrderedCollection
member.summary: A subtype of Collection (here implemented as ) in which members of the logical collection are assumed to always be strictly ordered. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.IOrderedCollectionPage
member.summary: Used to represent ordered subsets of items from an OrderedCollection (here implemented as ). Refer to the Activity Streams 2.0 Core specification for a complete description of the OrderedCollectionPage object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.Collection.IOrderedCollectionPage.StartIndex
member.summary: A non-negative integer value identifying the relative position within the logical view of a strictly ordered collection.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType
member.summary: A CoreType is an abstract base type for all ActivityStreams types.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.Id
member.summary: Provides the globally unique identifier for an Object (here implemented as ) or Link (here implemented as ).

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.Context
member.summary:
Identifies the context within which the object exists or an activity was performed.
The notion of "context" used is intentionally vague.The intended function is to serve as a means of grouping objects and activities that share a common originating context or purpose. An example could be all activities relating to a common project or event. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.Type
member.summary: W3.org documentation is unclear as to whether this is a URI or not.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.AttributedTo
member.summary: Identifies one or more entities to which this object is attributed. The attributed entities might not be Actors. For instance, an object might be attributed to the completion of another activity. See w3.org for further details. Must be either or .

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.Preview
member.summary: Identifies an entity that provides a preview of this object. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details. Must be either or .

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.Name
member.summary: A simple, human-readable, plain-text name for the object. HTML markup must not be included. The name may be expressed using multiple language-tagged values. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ICoreType.MediaType
member.summary:
When used on a Link, identifies the MIME media type of the referenced resource.
When used on an Object, identifies the MIME media type of the value of the content property.If not specified, the content property is assumed to contain text/html content. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ILink
member.summary: A Link is an indirect, qualified reference to a resource identified by a URL. The fundamental model for links is established by [RFC5988]. Many of the properties defined by the Activity Vocabulary allow values that are either instances of Object (here implemented as ) or Link. When a Link is used, it establishes a qualified relation connecting the subject (the containing object) to the resource identified by the href. Properties of the Link are properties of the reference as opposed to properties of the resource. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ILink.Href
member.summary: The target resource pointed to by a Link (here implemented as ). See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ILink.Rel
member.summary:
A link relation associated with a Link.The value must conform to both the[HTML5] and[RFC5988] "link relation" definitions.
In the[HTML5], any string not containing the "space" U+0020, "tab" (U+0009), "LF" (U+000A), "FF" (U+000C), "CR" (U+000D) or "," (U+002C) characters can be used as a valid link relation. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ILink.HrefLang
member.summary: Hints as to the language used by the target resource. Value must be a BCP47 Language-Tag. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ILink.Height
member.summary: On a Link (here implemented as ), specifies a hint as to the rendering height in device-independent pixels of the linked resource. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.ILink.Width
member.summary: On a Link (here implemented as ), specifies a hint as to the rendering width in device-independent pixels of the linked resource. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject
member.summary: Describes an object of any kind. The Object type serves as the base type for most of the other kinds of objects defined in the Activity Vocabulary, including other Core types such as Activity (here implemented as ), IntransitiveActivity (here implemented as ), Collection (here implemented as ) and OrderedCollection (here implemented as ). See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Attachment
member.summary: Identifies a resource attached or related to an object that potentially requires special handling. The intent is to provide a model that is at least semantically similar to attachments in email. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Audience
member.summary: Identifies one or more entities that represent the total population of entities for which the object can considered to be relevant. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Content
member.summary:
The content or textual representation of the Object encoded as a JSON string. By default, the value of content is HTML.The mediaType property can be used in the object to indicate a different content type.
The content may be expressed using multiple language-tagged values. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.EndTime
member.summary: The date and time describing the actual or expected ending time of the object. When used with an Activity object, for instance, the endTime property specifies the moment the activity concluded or is expected to conclude. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Generator
member.summary: Identifies the entity (e.g. an application) that generated the object. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Icon
member.summary: Indicates an entity that describes an icon for this object. The image should have an aspect ratio of one (horizontal) to one (vertical) and should be suitable for presentation at a small size. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Image
member.summary: Indicates an entity that describes an image for this object. Unlike the icon property, there are no aspect ratio or display size limitations assumed. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.InReplyTo
member.summary: Indicates one or more entities for which this object is considered a response. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Location
member.summary: Indicates one or more physical or logical locations associated with the object. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Published
member.summary: The date and time at which the object was published See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Replies
member.summary: Identifies a Collection containing objects considered to be responses to this object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.StartTime
member.summary: The date and time describing the actual or expected starting time of the object. When used with an Activity object, for instance, the startTime property specifies the moment the activity began or is scheduled to begin. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Summary
member.summary: A natural language summarization of the object encoded as HTML. Multiple language tagged summaries may be provided. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Tag
member.summary: One or more "tags" that have been associated with an objects. A tag can be any kind of Object. The key difference between attachment and tag is that the former implies association by inclusion, while the latter implies associated by reference. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Updated
member.summary: The date and time at which the object was updated See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Url
member.summary: Identifies one or more links to representations of the object Must be either xsd:anyURI or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.To
member.summary: Identifies an entity considered to be part of the public primary audience of an Object Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Bto
member.summary: Identifies an Object that is part of the private primary audience of this Object. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Cc
member.summary: Identifies an Object that is part of the public secondary audience of this Object. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Bcc
member.summary: Identifies one or more Objects that are part of the private secondary audience of this Object. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Core.IObject.Duration
member.summary: When the object describes a time-bound resource, such as an audio or video, a meeting, etc, the duration property indicates the object's approximate duration. The value must be expressed as an xsd:duration as defined by xmlschema11-2, section 3.3.6 (e.g. a period of 5 seconds is represented as "PT5S").

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IAccept
member.summary: Indicates that the actor accepts the object. The target property can be used in certain circumstances to indicate the context into which the object has been accepted. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IAdd
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has added the object to the target. If the target property is not explicitly specified, the target would need to be determined implicitly by context. The origin can be used to identify the context from which the object originated. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IAnnounce
member.summary:
Indicates that the actor is calling the target's attention the object.
The origin typically has no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IArrive
member.summary: An IntransitiveActivity (here implemented as ) that indicates that the actor has arrived at the location. The origin can be used to identify the context from which the actor originated. The target typically has no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IBlock
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is blocking the object. Blocking is a stronger form of Ignore (here implemented as ). The typical use is to support social systems that allow one user to block activities or content of other users. The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.ICreate
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has created the object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IDelete
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has deleted the object. If specified, the origin indicates the context from which the object was deleted. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IDislike
member.summary: Indicates that the actor dislikes the object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IFlag
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is "flagging" the object. Flagging is defined in the sense common to many social platforms as reporting content as being inappropriate for any number of reasons. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IFollow
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is "following" the object. Following is defined in the sense typically used within Social systems in which the actor is interested in any activity performed by or on the object. The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IIgnore
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is ignoring the object. The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IInvite
member.summary: A specialization of Offer (here implemented as ) in which the actor is extending an invitation for the object to the target. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IJoin
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has joined the object. The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.ILeave
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has left the object. The target and origin typically have no meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.ILike
member.summary: Indicates that the actor likes, recommends or endorses the object. The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IListen
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has listened to the object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IMove
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has moved object from origin to target. If the origin or target are not specified, either can be determined by context. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IOffer
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is offering the object. If specified, the target indicates the entity to which the object is being offered. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IQuestion
member.summary:
Represents a question being asked. Question objects are an extension of IntransitiveActivity (here implemented as ). That is, the Question object is an Activity (here implemented as ), but the direct object is the question itself and therefore it would not contain an object property.
Either of the anyOf and oneOf properties may be used to express possible answers, but a Question object must not have both properties. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IQuestion.OneOf
member.summary: Identifies an exclusive option for a Question. Use of oneOf> implies that the Question can have only a single answer. To indicate that a Question can have multiple answers, use anyOf. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IQuestion.AnyOf
member.summary: Identifies an inclusive option for a Question. Use of anyOf implies that the Question can have multiple answers. To indicate that a Question can have only one answer, use oneOf. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IQuestion.Closed
member.summary: Indicates that a question has been closed, and answers are no longer accepted. Must be either or or xsd:dateTime or xsd:boolean. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IRead
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has read the object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IReject
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is rejecting the object. The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IRemove
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is removing the object. If specified, the origin indicates the context from which the object is being removed. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.ITentativeAccept
member.summary: A specialization of Accept (here implemented as ) indicating that the acceptance is tentative. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.ITentativeReject
member.summary: A specialization of Reject (here implemented as ) in which the rejection is considered tentative. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.ITravel
member.summary: Indicates that the actor is traveling to target from origin. Travel is an IntransitiveObject (here implemented as ) whose actor specifies the direct object. If the target or origin are not specified, either can be determined by context. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IUndo
member.summary:
Indicates that the actor is undoing the object. In most cases, the object will be an Activity (here implemented as ) describing some previously performed action (for instance, a person may have previously "liked" an article but, for whatever reason, might choose to undo that like at some later point in time).
The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IUpdate
member.summary:
Indicates that the actor has updated the object. Note, however, that this vocabulary does not define a mechanism for describing the actual set of modifications made to object.
The target and origin typically have no defined meaning. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Activity.IView
member.summary: Indicates that the actor has viewed the object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Actor.IApplication
member.summary: Describes a software application. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Actor.IGroup
member.summary: Represents a formal or informal collective of Actors. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Actor.IOrganization
member.summary: Represents an organization. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Actor.IPerson
member.summary: Represents an individual person. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Actor.IService
member.summary: Represents a service of any kind. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IArticle
member.summary: Represents any kind of multi-paragraph written work. See w3.org for further details.

example.code:
{ "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "type": "Article", "name": "What a Crazy Day I Had", "content": "
... you will never believe ...", "attributedTo": "http://sally.example.org" }

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IAudio
member.summary: Represents an audio document of any kind. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IDocument
member.summary: Represents a document of any kind. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IEvent
member.summary: Represents any kind of event. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IImage
member.summary: An image document of any kind See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IMention
member.summary:
https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams#Mention
A specialized Link (here implemented as ) that represents an @mention. See w3.org for further details.

example.code: { "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "summary": "Mention of Joe by Carrie in her note", "type": "Mention", "href": "http://example.org/joe", "name": "Joe" }

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.INote
member.summary: Represents a short written work typically less than a single paragraph in length. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPage
member.summary: Represents a Web Page. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace
member.summary: Represents a logical or physical location. See 5.3 Representing Places for additional information. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace.Accuracy
member.summary: Indicates the accuracy of position coordinates on a Place objects. Expressed in properties of percentage. e.g. "94.0" means "94.0% accurate". Valid range is between 0.0f and 100.0f. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace.Altitude
member.summary: Indicates the altitude of a place. The measurement units is indicated using the units property. If units is not specified, the default is assumed to be "m" indicating meters. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of a place See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of a place See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace.Radius
member.summary: The radius from the given latitude and longitude for a Place. The units is expressed by the units property. If units is not specified, the default is assumed to be "m" indicating "meters". See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IPlace.Units
member.summary: Specifies the measurement units for the radius and altitude properties on a Place object (here implemented as ). If not specified, the default is assumed to be "m" for "meters". See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IProfile
member.summary: A Profile is a content object that describes another Object, typically used to describe Actor Type objects. The describes property is used to reference the object being described by the profile. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IProfile.Describes
member.summary: On a Profile object, the describes property identifies the object described by the Profile. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IRelationship
member.summary:
Describes a relationship between two individuals. The subject and object properties are used to identify the connected individuals.
See 5.2 Representing Relationships Between Entities for additional information. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IRelationship.Subject
member.summary: On a Relationship object, the subject property identifies one of the connected individuals. For instance, for a Relationship object describing "John is related to Sally", subject would refer to John. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IRelationship.Object
member.summary: When used within a Relationship describes the entity to which the subject is related. Must be either or . See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IRelationship.Relationship
member.summary: On a Relationship object, the relationship property identifies the kind of relationship that exists between subject and object. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.ITombstone
member.summary: A Tombstone represents a content object that has been deleted. It can be used in Collections (here implemented as ) to signify that there used to be an object at this position, but it has been deleted. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.ITombstone.FormerType
member.summary: On a Tombstone object, the formerType property identifies the type of the object that was deleted. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: P:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.ITombstone.Deleted
member.summary: On a Tombstone object, the deleted property is a timestamp for when the object was deleted. See w3.org for further details.

member.name: T:ActivityStreams.Contract.Extended.Object.IVideo
